subject: Re: [junit]
msgSnippet: I think the simples and fastest way is to : 1) Add the junit.jar to your filesystem. 2) Create a new template for a subclass of TestCase by copying the Main
messageBody:
I think the simples and fastest way is to :

1) Add the junit.jar to your filesystem.
2) Create a new template for a subclass of TestCase by copying the Main Class
Template and pasting it in the template with a new name such as TestClass.
3) Modify the template. Mine is shown below.

-H

/*
* __NAME__.java
*
* Created on __DATE__, __TIME__
*/

package Templates.Classes;

/**
*
* @author __USER__
* @version
*/
public class ClassTest extends junit.framework.TestCase {

/** Creates new __NAME__ */
public ClassTest(java.lang.String testName) {
super(testName);
}

/**
* @param args the command line arguments
*/
public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.swingui.TestRunner.main(new String[] {__NAME__.class.getName()});
}

}


--- rejith <rejith_mn@...> wrote:
> Hi Everybody,
>
> Can somebody help me in integrating junit with Forte for java ?
> And should I have to write the test cases for all classes ?
> How can we test the servelets and all ?
>
> Regards
> Rejith
